reviews.title: great location, Loved the decor!
reviews.text: The Hotel is in the centre of Venice on the island right next to the bus station and just opposite the triain station, its right on the grand canal next to vapperetta stop.

The hotel looks dodgy from the outside and in need of painting, but thats like all the buildings in venice, once your inside the reception area is very nice and modern with an antique feel in the style of the furniture and grand mirrors etc, the room continues this feel with old fashioned style chairs, cupboards and the wallpaper is padded and very ornate giving you the feeling of being in the set from Inteveiw with a vampire, very cool. The bedroom has air conditioning which is great after a hot day walking about sightseeing, the bathroom is very modern with bath, shower and bidet. The breakfast is served in the garden in the summer and is continental like most in the area, its ok but nothing special.
reviews.title: Thumbs down

likes.liked: — Good location and Good view from room (provided you get a room at the front or side)
likes.disliked: — Staff, Breakfasts, Room too small, Dusty, Decor

reviews.text: Overall good value for money, great location and freindly helpful staff.
reviews.title: Great location, nice staff and adequate facilities
Good value no frills in convenient location
reviews.text: Having stayed in two other hotels in Florence and Pisa, this was the last leg of our trip and we were very disappointed with this hotel. The hotel has a good location just across from the train station, its also 5 mins from Piazzale Roma. Very little would make me recommend this hotel. Our saving grace was the view and location. The staff were not friendly, the breakfast was awful, the lukewarm coffee was served out of a flask! But the worst of all was the accommodation, two adults and two teenage children squashed into what should have been a small double room. It had a double bed and two singles, wardrobe and two lockers, we could hardly move. Apart from being extremely small, the room was dusty. Every time we lay on the bed a cloud of visable dust flew up into the air, Lastly there was an air conditioning unit in the room but we certainly never felt the effects of it. The heat was practically unbearable. In case anyone is in doubt I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent location, but small bathroom
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here 3 nights in July, we are in our early 20s. The hotel is in an excellent location - right across from the train station on the grand canal, very close to great restaurants(much cheaper than restaurants near St. Marks Square, etc) and good shopping. It is only a 20-30 min water taxi ride to the main sights but its nice to see Venice along the way.

reviews.title: OK, but refuse room 212!
reviews.text: We returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel last week. We had requested a twin, canal view room, but for our first night we were allocated Rm 212, which is just wide enough to take two exceptionally narrow single beds and one very slim bedside cabinet. Fortunately we were able to move to a larger, canal view room for the next 3 nights, but had to pay an extra 20 euros per night for this. In conversation with other guests it emerged that they too had initially been allocated "cupboards" and after complaining they were moved to proper rooms at an extra cost. Apart from this the hotel is fine; nice staff, good breakfast in the garden, brilliant location etc.

reviews.title: OK
reviews.text: The previous descriptions are mostly accurate. It is an ok inexpensive hotel. I would be upset if it weren't so cheap. Our room was on the 1st floor facing a "courtyard" which consisted of painted sewer drainage pipes from the hotel next door. The painting was creative, but at 6AM, the odor actually woke me up. We had the window open for air because there was no AC in March and it was stuffy. No one at the hotel could understand what I was describing--the ugly American. I have been in Venice before and understand that it can smell. We get the same thing in Florida sometimes. But it was special.
So, we had an enjoyable trip most of the time. I wish I knew more about what room to look for in this hotel. Breakfast was ok, basic. Staff was nice.
reviews.title: Great location but small rooms
tourist
reviews.text: This hotel is in a brilliant location on the banks of the Grand Canal close to the bus station, railway station and a Vaporetto stop. Expedia describes it as a "Venetian Palace" but I would describe it more as an average Bed and Breakfast.

reviews.title: OK for the price.
reviews.text: Externally it looks almost derelect (see picture) but it was quite different inside. The hotel was clean and the staff are friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paid about $110 CDN via expedia per night. The hotel is nice and clean, staff is friendly. Location is close to the ACTV (water bus) and across the way from the train station. It is quite a walks away from the tourist sites of Venice though (St. Mark's square and the bridge is about 10 mins walk away).
reviews.title: not close to st mark's square... but close to train stn

reviews.text: One of the few hotels in europe that has a bath tub in the hotel room. Most hotels only have stand up showers. Free continental breakfast was good... actually had fruit!!!!!
reviews.title: Location quite good hotel overpriced
Down the Canal
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in September. The location of the hotel is good, just on the canal and a couple of minutes walk to the waterbus. Its a good half hour walk to St Marks Square Rialto Bridge etc...my advice is to take the waterbus! The hotel is very basic (not 3*) and looks grubby from the outside. The rooms are tiny and there is no lift so if you have any difficulty climbing stairs this hotel is not for you! We had a room looking over the canal which seemed nice at first but it 's very noisy all day and night which made sleeping difficult. The breakfast is not great and very repetitve, however, we visited several other cities in Italy and found this to be the case everywhere. My advice to anyone going to venice for a few days is to stay in Lido the hotels are better and much cheaper as is eating out and everything else. It is only 20 mins trip on the Waterbus and these are very frequent. If we return we will definately be staying here as opposed to the centre of Venice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was not only shabby from the exterior but the bedroom was just terrible. Wallpaper was missing from one wall and part of another leaving exposed plaster. The lampshades were falling apart and the room itself was small with very little clothes space. The ensuite bathroom had mould around bath and up the walls. The shower was not fitted onto the wall. There was a hole was in the back of the door where the door knocked the pipe each time it was opended.
reviews.title: Staff was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a positive side the bedlinen and towels were clean and breakfast was adequate.
reviews.title: Questionable...........

reviews.text: Very noisy in the mornings as room was at pedestrian level and also noise from the speed boats.
reviews.title: excellent

likes.liked: — location close to railway, and canal views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the hotel was adequate and for the price which was quite expensive you would expect the decor to be updated a little and rooms renovated to a more modern standard.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also , the locals are the most ignorant you can meet in the world.
reviews.title: Handy location, nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (Canadian couple late sixties) found this hotel to be acceptable, but not much more. It was fairly expensive, but well-located on the Grand Canal just across from the train station. The staff were reasonably helpful with extra pillows, city maps, booking reservations, but not particularly friendly. The room had a very high ceiling; turning it on its side would have increased the surface area substantially. There was only about eighteen inches clearance between double bed and walls, making it difficult to open the mini-fridge. The bathroom seemed designed for garden dwarves or Zurich gnomes. Breakfast was just adequate; some sort of artificial juice, rolls and coffee. Our room did have a view of two canals but was not as quiet as we would have liked. There were a lot of stairs to climb to reach our room. All in all a neutral experience. Loved Venice though.
reviews.title: A Lilliputian Hotel

reviews.text: Great Location.
reviews.title: Great Locaton and View.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed 2 nights at the Canal Hotel for New Year's 2007. While it's not exactly elegant, it was fine for what it was- and that is old. If you are arriving by train, the hotel is right across the Grand Canal from the train station, making it very convenient. We paid upwards of $175/night, but it was also New Year's and the city was booked. Our room overlooked the corner of the Grand Canal and the side canal, right by the bridge. The views from the room were great- though it did get a bit loud from the boat traffic. Be sure to request a canal view. The outside of the hotel does need a facelift, or something, but doesn't every building in Venice? Our room had a double bed (please note in Europe, this means 2 twin beds stuck together, so get used to falling in the 'crack'). The ceilings were quite tall, but our square footage was not much- barely enough room to put all our luggage. There was a cabinet though, which held some items. The bathroom was typically small, though it did have a bathtub (which we used), and that was a treat. The staff at the front desk was helpful, though there was a semi-rude breakfast lady who didn't seem very nice. Speaking of breakfast, it can easily be skipped at this hotel. It is very basic- some bread, juice, yogurt, and coffee. We opted to skip breakfast the second morning. One nice thing about the hotel is that they bake their croissants early in the morning, so both mornings we were actually awakened by a pleasant smell of fresh bread seeping through the entire place- it made our mouths water in bed! Note, there are stairs that you will have to lug your luggage up and down, and 'luggage keep' means stashing your luggage in the breakfast room (they don't have a separate locked room), so make sure you take all your valuables. One drawback of the hotel is that it's a long walk to Rialto (20 min.) and St. Mark's Square (30 min.), and you have to walk through the crowded and narrow alleys- but at least it's scenic... I mean you are in Venice (at least there are signs- to get back to the hotel, just follow the signs that say 'Piazza Roma', since it's near the hotel. Luckily, there is also a water bus stop nearby, which will take you to the main sites too, but be ready for a pushy crowded and long boat ride for 5 Euro. Overall, a basic hotel that could use some upgrading, but is in a good location for proximity to transportation, which is important in a carless city like Venice!
reviews.title: Simple hotel, great location for transportation

likes.liked: — Convienient to train station, water bus, fresh bread smell in morning, nice view of canal
likes.disliked: — Small room, old, far from St. Mark's Square, breakfast needs to be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for four nights in nov. This was our second stay and we would be happy to stay there again. We asked for and got a room over looking the grand canal. Breakfast was excellent and the location across from the train station is hard to beat if you are coming in by train. Have had friends stay there and they were also very happy. If you are arriving by car it is very near were the busses from the car park drop you off.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in May and it was a very nice little hotel. It is just across the canal from the train station so it is not very far to go if you have a lot of luggage. The room was decorated in an antique style and had lots of atmoshere - it fit in perfectly with the whole flow of Venice. It was definitley the softest bed we had in the whole 2 week stay which was nice. The breakfast room was cute and had lots of Venetian glass lighting and fabric covered walls. I would recommend this hotel it you want to stay near the station and close to public transport (the traghetto stop is just across the canal).
reviews.title: Good Choice in Venice

reviews.text: Going to Venice in the week before Easter is a real challenge if you wish to have a room with a typical Italian character and decent comfort - especially if you are three persons (couple +son). With the guidance of the TripAdvisor reviews we managed to find this superb place that met all our expectations.
reviews.title: A splendid place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a room in the "Canal building" of the hotel, the Walter building is the neighbouring building connected by interior floors (the brownish one on the photo). Our room was a dream location, just abouve the reception hall with a large balcony to the Canale Grande. In the very early morning we could watch from our beds the supply boats that came in with all kind of merchandise. This parade was worth the whole trip and I recommend this experience to all visitors to Venice.
reviews.title: Happily stay here again

reviews.text: Another special plus of this hotel is its perfect location close to Piazza Roma (central bus station) and to the railway station, which are both only 5 minutes by foot. Apart from these outstanding features, everything was very sound indeed: prices (still keep in mind the elevated Venice price level!), friendliness and efficiency at the reception, and a breakfast buffet beyond Italian standards. Having had less convincing experiences at other locations before, it is no question to us that we shall try to get a booking at Hotel Canal and Walter for any future stay at Venice.
reviews.title: Loved this little gem

likes.liked: — Location and it was very close to a large grocery store so we loaded up on wine and water!

reviews.title: It's OK to go here
reviews.text: Totally enjoyed our 3 night stay here. Our room was large, overlooking the small courtyard. It was quiet, comfortable, & had all the amenities one needs when travelling (room to hang clothes, safe box, room for suitcases, comfortable bathroom). Even the morning breakfast was decent.
